intro: Robertium modestum, commonly known as the modest moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshade plants. The plant is characterized by its white, fragrant flowers that open at night and close during the day. Robertium modestum typically grows in humid, tropical environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
